metadata.title: CVE-2022-48622 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In GNOME GdkPixbuf (aka gdk-pixbuf) through 2.42.10, the ANI (Windowsanimated cursor) decoder encounters heap memory corruption (inani_load_chunk in io-ani.c) when parsing chunks in a crafted .ani file. Acrafted file could allow an attacker to overwrite heap metadata, leading toa denial of service or code execution attack. This occurs ingdk_pixbuf_set_option() in gdk-pixbuf.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.5
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.5
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-bin - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.5
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.5').
